required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence, Persistence, and Risk Factors for Oral Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Infections in College Women
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence, Persistence, and Risk Factors for Oral HPV Infections in College Women

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine how common oral HPV infections are in college women. The investigators also will find out what risk factors are associated with having oral HPV infections. The investigators hypothesize that approximately 3% of women will have oral HPV, and that HPV will be associated with oral sexual behaviors and with smoking behaviors. Finally, for those women with oral HPV- the investigators will determine whether the infections are persistent (still present) at 3-, 6-, and 12-months after the initial diagnosis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistence of oral HPV over 1 year of follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Determine whether HPV remains present at 3-months, 6-months, and 12-months after enrollment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >=18 years
- Female
- Currently enrolled as a college student
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to provide an oral rinse sample
- Unable to complete survey
- Unable to provide contact information
- Already completed study.
